required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Competitive Accuracy of Radiological Imaging Compared to Liver Biopsy in Patients With Liver Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Competitive Accuracy of Radiological Imaging Compared to Liver Biopsy in Patients With Liver Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: The study "Competitive Accuracy of Radiological Imaging Compared to Liver Biopsy in Patients With Liver Fibrosis" is designed to test the accuracy of non-interventional radiological imaging and compare its results with the "gold standard" liver biopsy. This is prospective non-randomized single patient group study.

primary_outcome.measure: Ultrasound elastography comparison to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen
primary_outcome.description: Liver stiffness measured by ultrasound elastography (2D-SWE) in kPa is compared to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen at a single time point before initiating antiviral treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin comparison to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen I
primary_outcome.description: Dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin parameter liver clearance (%/min/m2) is compared to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen at a single time point before initiating antiviral treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin comparison to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen II
primary_outcome.description: Dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin parameter uptake time (min.) is compared to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen at a single time point before initiating antiviral treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin comparison to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen III
primary_outcome.description: Dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin parameter liver excretion (30 min./peak ratio) is compared to histological examination of liver biopsy specimen at a single time point before initiating antiviral treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of radiological imaging tests between each other I
secondary_outcome.description: Liver stiffness measured by ultrasound elastography (2D-SWE) in kPa is compared to liver clearance measured by dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of radiological imaging tests between each other II
secondary_outcome.description: Liver stiffness measured by ultrasound elastography (2D-SWE) in kPa is compared to tracer excretion measured by dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of radiological imaging tests between each other III
secondary_outcome.description: Liver stiffness measured by ultrasound elastography (2D-SWE) in kPa is compared to tracer uptake time measured by dynamic liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with viral chronic liver disease at primary diagnosis
arm_group.description: Patients with primary diagnosis of viral hepatitis B and hepatitis C who was referred for liver biopsy. All patients underwent liver shear wave elastography and dynamic liver scintigraphy evaluating liver physical and functional changes shortly prior to liver biopsy procedure.

intervention.description: All patients were referred for 2D-SWE liver elastography and liver liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin prior to liver biopsy.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with viral chronic liver disease at primary diagnosis

intervention.description: All patients were referred for 2D-SWE liver elastography and liver liver scintigraphy with 99mTc-mebrofenin prior to liver biopsy.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with viral chronic liver disease at primary diagnosis

study_pop.textblock: Patients with primary diagnosis of chronic viral liver disease who are referred treating gastroenterologist/infectologist for liver biopsy prior to treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- chronic liver disease
- signed informed consent
- liver biopsy indicated by treating gastroenterologist/infectologist
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-corrected blood coagulation tests
- acute liver disease
- age below 18 years or above 80 years
- disagreement to participate in the study
- pregnancy
